intro: Coelorachis pubescens, commonly known as the hairy coelorachis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers with a distinctive yellowish-green color. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine, hairy textures, contributing to its common name. Coelorachis pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
